body:
> > > `org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.conf.Config.Logging#OUTPUT` is modifiable at runtime and the real writer may change, after your patch the modification of `Config.Logging#OUTPUT` takes no effect.
> > > Although I think we hardly ever change the `Config.Logging#OUTPUT` at runtime, but the unit tests do this in order to verify, so I think you should either modify the unit test accordingly, or keep everthing unchanged, WDYT @wu-sheng
> > 
> > 
> > @kezhenxu94 I see. But why we change the output type at runtime? is there a real scene?
> 
> I think the answer is NO, but you have to make the CI pass at least, it changes the output type at runtime, just for verification :)

I don't know why Dubbo rest doesn't support this. It is common in HTTP, as you can see, this header has no issue in other REST frameworks. Could you submit an issue at Dubbo, and we could start a discussion at there?
@SevenBlue2018 Copy the JSON to a file and uploaded. We need the whole text to debug and find out why.
ok
Search the issue before submit duplicated one. Your timezone or time is not right of your ENV.

I think this dubbo rest protocol claim this format。this code exist more year~

then，I review skywarking source， this problem happen becase BASE64。

this class define common BASE64 format，but this is used for resolve jre 6 no base64 encoder。

maybe use urlencode can resolve this problem？
We can't change the format, my question is about why. BASE64 is working in most frameworks, and what is the issue of Dubbo REST.

5 languages agents are sharing this protocol, so we can't see any chance to change it, and I am open to talk about why this is an issue to Dubbo. Because in REST, the peer side could be an un-dubbo service, if they put `=` in the header value, it looks like a break too.

Would not this an issue to Dubbo rather than to SkyWalking?

There is a lot of `=` existing in HTTP header, ref a simple blog, https://code.tutsplus.com/tutorials/http-headers-for-dummies--net-8039

yes,i know your mean.but some people use dubbo rest,I think we can't wait dubbo fixbug.I recognition this is dubbo rest problem。ok,I will review dubbo source. close this issue，and try submit an issue at Dubbo。we like this project，and we have 40 micro service。so we need one trace service used quick。maybe we only fork skywalking quick fix this problem and wait dubbo fix this bug

Oh，I see because we use Dubbo-Attachments this head to pass trace info。this is have some limit。
dubbo RpcContextFilter limit this header not use , and =。I think this head have many of other effect。this code have exist more year。

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/commit/2f86b1b3ee58e09b576f6d0d641e7a40b593abba

this commit resolve this problem？
Oh, We use dubbo 2.6.6..this hava problem? I think this exception not because version.dubbo master branch have this limit too.

You are thinking Dubbo ecosystem would not change, but ask SkyWalking to change, I am afraid this is not going to happen. In reality, the only way is to keep this in public discussion, especially in Dubbo community, because they set the limits, right?

Please forward this issue to Dubbo, and let's talk what happens. SkyWalking can't change header protocol, it is public and even sealed. This is the protocol level for us. From my perspective, I could help you to argue with Dubbo community, rather than change the protocol. 

SkyWalking relies on our protocol stable very much. Dubbo community would not change protocol easily too, but this limit should not a protocol level thing.

yes，I review dubbo rest source。dubbo rest ‘s Attachments is not a good implement。I know why this is happen now。。this not skywalking problem。。。you are right。and review own code。 We only use common method call something，is a great implement。ok，I subbmit issue or pr for dubbo。thank your help。

@wu-sheng `PatternLoggerTest` this is one of the unstable unit tests AFAIK, other unstable tests like `TraceSegmentServiceClientTest` are all singletons, so I think the reason why they fail sometimes is the states they hold are changed somewhere else (in other unit tests), I'll just re-run the CI here and will get some time to dig more into this

I didn't find a better way than regular expressions, the idea looks good to me, but seems it will have a serious performance impact on the agent, besides, I have a couple of questions:

0. Can the normalization be done in backend? What's the pros and cons?
0. The operations will evolve for sure, deleting operations does no harm though, but adding and updating operations (done in `dev` side) requires updating the rules accordingly (usually done in `ops` side), and we don't support dynamical configuration in agent side, it may be hard to mantain the rules in time

> Can the normalization be done in backend? What's the pros and cons?

Backend thing still costs the same CPU, same calculation same CPU costs, just different places. I am thinking about tradeoff, regex is powerful, but I don't intend to do so. Just support `*` should be enough.
And make the agent cache harder. Right?

> The operations will evolve for sure, deleting operations does no harm though, but adding and updating operations (done in dev side) requires updating the rules accordingly (usually done in ops side), and we don't support dynamical configuration in agent side, it may be hard to mantain the rules in time

That is another thing, how to downstream the config from OAP, which is not impossible, right? We have many static configurations today, I think this is not a block, just a feature wanted.

@kezhenxu94
And I also think, hold more frequently used configuration here, when users see those configurations, they know about the agent advanced features. Decrease the time of users look through documents.

Take a look at [how to create a pull request](https://help.github.com/en/articles/creating-a-pull-request#targetText=On%20GitHub%2C%20navigate%20to%20the,menu%2C%20click%20New%20pull%20request.) , that's general steps to contribute, as for plugin contribution, we'll need extra steps, creating auto tests for your plugin, documentations can be found [here](https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases)
Should i create a new branch like: feature/cassandra-v3-plugin, and push it, then ask someone to merge it?

Document updated w/ new code implementation.

# Operation Name Group Rule
Operation Name in auto instrumentation agent is unpredictable, some time, target application carries parameter in it, due to the parameter included in URI mostly.
Those operation name are also as known endpoint name in most cases.
Such as /api/checkTicket/tk/{userToken}.

We solved most of these cases, by leverage the parameter pattern path in framework, such as SpringMVC, Webflux, etc. 
But it is undetected in RPC client side, such as HTTP restful client.
In this case, we have to ask the users to set the group rule manually.

All rules are supported to set through agent.config, system properties and system env, like other agent settings.
- Config format, `plugin.opgroup.`plugin name`.rule[`rule name`]`=pattern regex expression

Multiple configuration items for a single plugin with different keys are supports, such as
1. plugin.opgroup.resttemplate.rule[/rule1]=/path1
1. plugin.opgroup.resttemplate.rule[/rule2]=/path2
1. plugin.opgroup.resttemplate.rule[/rule2]=/path3

We have following plugins supporting operation name group.

| Plugin | Config Key | Example |
|:----:|:-----:|:----|
|RestTemplate| plugin.opgroup.resttemplate.rule | plugin.opgroup.resttemplate.rule[/user/auth/{token}]=`\/user\/auth\/.*` |

@ascrutae Please review the Rest Template plugin change and run test for it.
ok

> Should i create a new branch like: feature/cassandra-v3-plugin, and push it, then ask someone to merge it?

It's not forcefully that you **should** create a new branch, but I think it's a good practice, so just create a new branch, and refer to [this](https://help.github.com/en/articles/creating-a-pull-request-from-a-fork) to create a pull request, then we'll review and merge if everthing is good.

Please remember that before merging you pull request, the auto test is required and you should create an auto test in the test repo: http://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases

@stone-wlg You need to fork this repo, then you have stone-wlg/skywalking. You could do anything there, then submit pull request to this main repo. As you are not a committer, so fork is the only option.

Check `MultiScopesSpanListener#L164`
> statement.setStatement(tag.getValue());

Add a config item in `TraceServiceModuleConfig`, named `MAX_SLOW_SQL_LENGTH`, and trim the string at above place.

This should be an easy and your first pull request.

hi, I found another column "DATA_BINARY" limit VARCHAR(20000), can't insert into table segment . how to resolve this problem best?

In `MySQLTableInstaller#getColumnType`, we should change the type to MEDIUMTEXT, when the `scope==DefaultScopeDefine.SEGMENT` and `name==SegmentRecord#DATA_BINARY`.

I think you should be able to fix this :) Send another pull request, please.
